segment.source: Driver Model Settings Properties for Driver Projects
segment.target: Driver Model Settings Properties for Driver Projects

segment.source: Sets the basic properties for a kernel-mode or user-mode driver, including the WDF library version and preprocessor definitions.
segment.target: Sets the basic properties for a kernel-mode or user-mode driver, including the WDF library version and preprocessor definitions.

segment.source: Setting driver model properties for driver projects
segment.target: Setting driver model properties for driver projects

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver project.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver project.

segment.source: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver project, click Configuration Properties and then click Driver Model Settings.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver project, click Configuration Properties and then click Driver Model Settings.

segment.source: Set the properties for the project.
segment.target: Set the properties for the project.

segment.source: Type of driver
segment.target: Type of driver

segment.source: The type of driver when the driver Configuration type is Driver.
segment.target: The type of driver when the driver Configuration type is Driver.

segment.source: Note that this option is available only when projects use the WindowsKernelModeDriver8.0 toolset.
segment.target: Note that this option is available only when projects use the WindowsKernelModeDriver8.0 toolset.

segment.source: Possible values are:
segment.target: Possible values are:

segment.source: WDM (including all miniport/port drivers such as NDIS or StorPort).
segment.target: WDM (including all miniport/port drivers such as NDIS or StorPort).

segment.source: KDMF A KMDF driver.
segment.target: KDMF A KMDF driver.

segment.source: Export driver (WDM) A WDM driver that exports functions which other drivers can call.
segment.target: Export driver (WDM) A WDM driver that exports functions which other drivers can call.

segment.source: For more information, see Creating Export Drivers.
segment.target: For more information, see Creating Export Drivers.

segment.source: KMDF Version Major
segment.target: KMDF Version Major

segment.source: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the major version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.
segment.target: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the major version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.

segment.source: The KMDF\_VERSION\_MAJOR entry informs the MSBuild utility that it must link the driver to the KMDF library.
segment.target: The KMDF\_VERSION\_MAJOR entry informs the MSBuild utility that it must link the driver to the KMDF library.

segment.source: You can build a KMDF driver for an earlier minor version of the library.
segment.target: You can build a KMDF driver for an earlier minor version of the library.

segment.source: For example, you could build a driver using KMDF Version Major=1 and KDMDF Version Minor=9 (KMDF Version 1.9) rather than 1.11 so that the driver could be shipped in a package containing an earlier version of the WDF co-installers.
segment.target: For example, you could build a driver using KMDF Version Major=1 and KDMDF Version Minor=9 (KMDF Version 1.9) rather than 1.11 so that the driver could be shipped in a package containing an earlier version of the WDF co-installers.

segment.source: For more information, see Framework Library Versioning.
segment.target: For more information, see Framework Library Versioning.

segment.source: KMDF Version Minor
segment.target: KMDF Version Minor

segment.source: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the minor version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.
segment.target: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the minor version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.

segment.source: For more information, see Framework Library Versioning (11, 9, 7, 5).
segment.target: For more information, see Framework Library Versioning (11, 9, 7, 5).

segment.source: If you omit the KMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.
segment.target: If you omit the KMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.

segment.source: UMDF Version Major
segment.target: UMDF Version Major

segment.source: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the major version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.
segment.target: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the major version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.

segment.source: See UMDF Version History.
segment.target: See UMDF Version History.

segment.source: When you have a UMDF driver, the Configuration type is Dynamic Library (.dll).
segment.target: When you have a UMDF driver, the Configuration type is Dynamic Library (.dll).

segment.source: UMDF Version Minor
segment.target: UMDF Version Minor

segment.source: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the minor version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver (11, 9, 7, 5).
segment.target: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the minor version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver (11, 9, 7, 5).

segment.source: If you omit the UMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.
segment.target: If you omit the UMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.

segment.source: Allow Date, Time, and Timestamp
segment.target: Allow Date, Time, and Timestamp

segment.source: Defines the standard C/CPP macros for \_\_DATE\_\_, \_\_TIME\_\_, \_\_TIMESTAMP\_\_.
segment.target: Defines the standard C/CPP macros for \_\_DATE\_\_, \_\_TIME\_\_, \_\_TIMESTAMP\_\_.

segment.source: Override Target Configuration Preprocessor Definitions
segment.target: Override Target Configuration Preprocessor Definitions

segment.source: Overrides the default values for preprocessing symbols: \_WIN32\_WINNT, WINVER, WINNT, and NTDDI\_VERSION for your source file.
segment.target: Overrides the default values for preprocessing symbols: \_WIN32\_WINNT, WINVER, WINNT, and NTDDI\_VERSION for your source file.

segment.source: Note that the default values are controlled by the current target configuration.
segment.target: Note that the default values are controlled by the current target configuration.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Framework Library Versioning
